content:
$3,678 monthly), the 30% housing cost guideline suggests maximum affordable housing costs of
$1,103 monthly. Current market rates place most rental options at or above this threshold, creating
cost burden even for median-income households.
Historic Context:
● 2019 median gross rent: $837
● Current average rent represents a 9.5% increase over 2019 levels
● Rental vacancy rate: 11.56% (2019), indicating supply constraints

Target Population Profiles
University Students: The Largest Underserved Market
University of Southern Mississippi Enrollment Data:
● Total enrollment: 13,110 students (2023)
● Undergraduate enrollment: 10,012 students
● Off-campus housing demand: 81% of students live off-campus
● Estimated off-campus population: 8,100+ students
Student Housing Challenges:
● Limited on-campus capacity housing only 3,500+ students
● Competition for off-campus housing drives up rental costs
● Student income sources typically include part-time work, family support, and financial aid
● Many students require shared housing arrangements to afford current market rates
Financial Profile:
● 40% receive Federal Pell Grants (indicating low-income status)
● Average student debt load creates additional financial pressure
● Part-time employment opportunities typically pay minimum wage ($7.25/hour in
Mississippi)
Healthcare Workers: Essential but Struggling
Employment and Wage Data:
● 6,230 healthcare practitioner and technical jobs in Hattiesburg (10% of local
employment)
● Average hourly wage: $39.77 ($82,722 annually)
